name: Sales Executive
description:
Job Summary

The Sales Executive is responsible for generating new business, as well as maintaining and deepening our existing customer relationships. This includes sourcing, coordinating with, and meeting potential customers in the industry that have cannabis testing needs. Primary areas of focus are identifying new customers, promoting existing customer retention, and successfully onboarding new accounts. This role is an outside sales position.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Provide the highest level of customer service at all times. This is a relationship business.
Partner with cannabis professionals to educate them regarding testing requirements and benefits that CannaSafe delivers (our value proposition).
Deliver market research to industry professionals.
Implement industry knowledge to strengthen our existing customer relationships and broaden our lead pipeline.
Serve as a subject matter expert in our offerings, including, but not limited to, pricing, differentiation, and what we provide that our competitors do not.
Take sales orders and submit for processing per our internal SOP.
Educate customers on our process and ensure appropriate expectations are established and maintained regarding order timing and outcomes.
Deliver sales presentations to customers and for internal training purposes.
Network at industry events to gain key updates. Inform the team accordingly.
Perform heavy cold calling to schedule in person appointments. This may require creative sourcing methods, such as leveraging social media.
Meet our minimum number of in person and telephonic customer check-in meetings each week. These are focused on growing existing relationships and expanding services.
Hit and surpass other quotas as defined by the TBD Sales Leader.
Regularly maintain accurate, detailed, and current notes in HubSpot. This includes notes for existing and potential contacts.
Partner will all levels of employees to ensure communication is seamless at all times regarding updates to customer orders.
Generate and regularly deliver a variety of reports to the Leadership team.
Foster a success-oriented, accountable, and ethical environment.
Build strong internal, external, and cross-functional relationships.
Other duties and special projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

High degrees of self-motivation, initiative, sales acumen, analytical/technical ability, and decisive judgement.
Ability to build positive relationships and nurture them as needed in a sales environment.
Ability to maintain an incredibly high degree of attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to maintain confidence, confidentially, and composure during difficult and/or complex situations.
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced deadline environment while successfully managing multiple tasks.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively work, influence, problem solve, and communicate with all levels of the organization.
Proven work experience as sales representative in Cannabis Sales/lab Services
Travel up to 50%, including overnight travel.

Education and Experience
Required: A high school diploma (or GED) and at least three (3) years of related sales experience.
Required: A valid driver’s license and clean driving record.
Knowledge of chemistry and analytical laboratory principles, terminology, practices, techniques, and instrumentation.
Exposure to the cannabis industry.

Essential Functions

The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job the employee is frequently required to stand, handle or feel, to speak, and to hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required for this job include close (proximity) vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment described here is representative of that which an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The standard analytical laboratory environment is one in which potential health hazards do exist. Administrative, operations, technical, and professional staff are expected to safely operate in accordance with applicable and appropriate health and safety policies and procedures, as prescribed by the applicable CannaSafe manuals and policies and/or federal, state, or local standards.

Laboratory staff can be expected to work in areas where hazards associated are with, but not limited to, airborne pathogens. Biological materials, hazardous substances, and radioactive material exist and are handled. Appropriate training is provided regarding these hazards and staff are expected to adhere to all health and safety policies at all times, whether they are in writing or verbalized by a supervisor.

name: Laboratory Technician - Micro
description:

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

401(k) plan offered
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
An educational reimbursement program
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our Orange, CA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Laboratory Technician to join our Microbiology Department.

As a key member of the laboratory team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

Daily monitoring of sample scheduling and ensure that samples are analyzed within EPA’s holding time and clients’ due dates
Routine sample preparation and analysis according to Standard Methods (9223, 9221, 9215, 9230, 5210B, etc...), and CDC methods
Prepares media and reagents
Performs initial review of data
Reviews of QA/QC criteria for batch acceptance
Adheres to Standard Operating Procedures and follow safe work practices
Run daily, monthly, quarterly and annual QC checks on micro equipment, media, supplies and materials
Perform data entry
Perform inventory, thermometers calibration,
Cross trains on inter-department and intra-department levels
Participates in lab’s meetings and focus teams
Work effectively with other departments

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

Associates degree or Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science, or related field
1 year of lab experience (academic or professional) preferred

Preferred Skills

1 year of lab experience (academic or professional) preferred
Familiar with microbiological methods and techniques
Able to accommodate flexible schedule including overtime, after-hours and weekend
Able to work independently and make sound decision
Excellent organization skills and strong communication skills

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

MAKE THE MOVE

From comprehensive air measurement and laboratory services to regulatory compliance, emergency response, permitting, engineering, and remediation, Montrose delivers innovative and practical design, engineering and operational solutions that keep its clients on top of their immediate needs – and well ahead of the strategic curve. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we’d love to speak with you.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

name: Quality Product Support Specialist
description: Lord Jones formulates, manufactures and distributes the world’s finest hemp-derived CBD infused products. Our company has been recognized as an industry leader by the New York Times, Vogue, Rolling Stone, Forbes, Fast Company and the New Yorker, among others. In October 2020, we launched our second hemp-derived CBD skincare brand, Happy Dance, with actress Kristen Bell. We make best-in-class products and are looking for ultra-talented employees to join us in a rapidly growing industry in the world.We hire talented people who thrive on solving difficult problems and give them the opportunity to hone new skills and approaches. You will be delivering product files, specifications and quality events at the Redwood Wellness Facility for cannabis products. You will interact with Analytical, Product Development, Contract Laboratories, Quality and Manufacturing as the SME on activities across technical services and quality management including product specifications (raw and finished) goods, stability studies, protocols, and quality support functions. The ideal candidate is energetic, collaborative, and forward- thinking.This position is based out of Los Angeles, California.What you’ll be doing: Investigate deviation, non-conformance events that occur in Quality Control areas; product submission to contract laboratoriesAuthor’s quality event reports to address non-conforming events; performs GMP internal auditsUse structured methodologies, including JMP Software, Process Mapping, or similar problem-solving tools to gather and analyze data to identify severity, support conclusion and determine corrective actionsCollaborate with Product Development and Analytical Sciences, as necessary, to perform assessment of analytical dataAuthors/Supports activities and documentation related to Quality Control, Stability Studies, Protocol DevelopmentWorks with cross-functional teams for the Material Review Board, Change Control, Product Submissions, Contract Laboratories and SuppliersContributes to the effectiveness of the Quality Management System including identification and implementation of improvement opportunities for processes, procedures, and product specificationsLeads planning scheduling, executing on Quality Control projects and supports programs operational readiness and product availabilityCreate product information documents from internal resources (QA, Regulatory, PD, Analytical) and external (suppliers, CMO) sourcesAuthors and contribute to GMP procedures such as SOPs, data trackers and JMP SoftwareWrite/revise specifications as necessary, performing analytical analysis and reviewing data for completeness and accuracyAnalysis data results and interpret for technical justifications for cannabinoidsSupport the development and execution of In Process QC TestingOwn the receipt of ingredients and documenting control numbers and ensuring shipments align with purchasesAssist with customer complaints, perform internal and external investigations if required and monitor problematic productsSend out products for analytical and microbiological testing to approved contract laboratoriesLearn and apply scientific and regulatory knowledge to support the claims and labels of cosmetics, topical, food and supplement products. Partner with PD, QA, Regulatory team to define specifications and review documentation for sufficiencyPrepare claims and labeling support documentation and educational materials*You’ll need to have: 3+ years’ experience in consumer product or drug R&D, QA or regulatory preferred, especially in the personal care, food, supplement areasDegree in Chemistry, Biological Science, Cosmetic Science, or related areasAble to research and evaluate scientific literature from different sources, including journals, study reports, analytical & microbiological test results, supplier technical data sheetsProficient with Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Knowledge of basic statisticsAttention to details and organized with documentation; fast learner, team player, able to work under tight timeline and identify contingency plansWe are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, and we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and people with diverse backgrounds, identities, and cultures. For candidates with disabilities, accommodations are available upon request in all phases of the selection process.Job Type: Full-time

name: Laboratory Scientist 3 - BPH - Kanawha Co.
description:
Nature of Work

Department of Health and Human Resources (DHHR)/ Bureau for Public Health (BPH)/ Office of Laboratory Services, Kanawha County - Under limited supervision, this position will perform advanced level analytical, diagnostic, environmental and epidemiological laboratory testing. Performs a variety of laboratory tests, assays, analytical procedure validations and quality assurance and control studies in such fields as analytical and environmental chemistry, diagnostic and environmental microbiology and immunology, biochemistry, molecular biology, and virology. This position works independently with limited supervision, work is characterized by the degree of difficulty required. Perform tests that require specialized knowledge, training, and judgment; adapts or develops standard procedures to the extent permitted by laboratory policies. May be subject to being on-call during non-business hours and must be available to respond when needed. May be exposed to chemical and biological hazards. This position broadly applies principles, and theories to job assignments and performs related work as required. Specific duties include performing quality control on media, reagents, and equipment used in testing research and develop microbiological methods for testing of medical cannabis and medical cannabis containing products, perform validation or verification of developed methods undergo contaminant identification testing on medical cannabis and medical cannabis containing products using traditional bacteriological techniques such as gram stain, culture and total aerobic bacteria and yeast mold counts, perform contaminant characteristic identification of cannabis including odor, appearance, fineess, and moisture content using appropriate methods, and contaminant confirmatory testing on medical cannabis and medical cannabis containing products for mycotoxins using molecular techniques such as polymerase chain reaction. Other duties as assigned.

IMPORTANT: Your eligible score will be based on information provided in your application; therefore, make sure your application is detailed and complete. You may attach a resume and other documents; however, you should NEVER enter "See Resume" on the application. You MUST complete ALL parts of the application, including the Work Experience section.

ATTENTION: Applicant MUST VERIFY POST-HIGH SCHOOL EDUCATION (DIPLOMAS, DEGREES, etc.), TRAINING, or LICENSURE EARNED pertaining to this position BY THE CLOSING DATE OF THE POSTING, if not previously verified. It may ONLY be in the form of a copy of an OFFICIAL transcript or diploma. If you are claiming Veteran's preference, please submit "MEMBER 4" form and/or your VA Letter. DOCUMENTATION WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED AFTER THE CLOSING DATE and you will not be considered for this vacancy. Please attach documents to the online application before submitting it. Or, you may email it to: applicantservices@wv.gov or by FAX to 304-957-0396, or by mail to: WV Division of Personnel, 1900 Kanawha Blvd. E., Building 3, Suite 500, Charleston, WV 25305.

This announcement is for one or more specific vacancies and only applies to the location(s) indicated. Your application will remain active for this job for 180 days or until the job is filled. Application for this job does not automatically qualify you for other positions. Be sure to submit your application for each position of interest. To receive an email notice anytime jobs in this or other categories are posted, you may choose to complete a Job Interest Card from the slide-out menu located at the top left of our Job Opportunities page.

As a condition of employment, an inquiry into job-related information will be completed which may include, but not limited to, criminal records, abuse registry records, driving records, employment history, and education and training. Failing to cooperate with this process, providing false or incomplete information, and/or discovery of disqualifying information may result in denial of or dismissal from employment or denial of transfer irrespective of when discovered.

Minimum Qualifications

Training: Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university in a biological, microbiological, chemical or environmental science, medical technology, molecular biology, forensic sciences or related field.
AND
Experience: Three (3) years of full-time or equivalent part-time paid laboratory experience that is clinical or environmental in nature that produces a test result.
OR
Substitution: Graduate course work in one of the areas as described above from a regionally accredited college or university may substitute at the rate of one (1) year experience for fifteen (15) semester hours of education.

Special Requirement: For positions which involve processing and analysis of human specimens and/or the generation or interpretation of laboratory results that may be used in the diagnosis or treatment of a disease or condition in humans, the incumbent must have or be eligible for licensure as a WV Clinical Laboratory Practitioner as required by 64C.S.R.§57.

***DETAILS OF RELATED EXPERIENCE MUST BE SHOWN IN THE WORK EXPERIENCE SECTION OF YOUR ONLINE APPLICATION***

name: Accreditation Officer (Electrical, ISO, Quality)
description: Description: A2LA is a non-profit, public service membership organization offering compliance and accreditation services to organizations all over the world. A2LA is dedicated to formally recognizing testing, calibration and other laboratories and related organizations for their quality and technical competency with a variety of international standards (ISO/IEC 17025, ISO 15189, etc.), federal requirements (FDA, GLP, FCC, etc.), state (cannabis, etc.), and local requirements (water testing, etc.).Whether it is the clean air that you breathe, the water you drink, or the vehicle you drive, A2LA helps make the world a better, safer place by working to ensure that organizations are releasing products and services that are meeting testing and quality standards. Detailed information about our services can be found on our website at www.a2la.org/about.The RoleA2LA is seeking a motivated professional to oversee the day-to-day accreditation operation and ensure the quality of laboratories by monitoring the processes, procedures, and applicable standards. This is an exceptional opportunity to grow within a global non-profit organization as an Accreditation Officer.A2LA provides extensive onsite training to ensure a candidate's success within our organization and in this position. This includes a detailed six-month mentoring program.About YouYou are a detail-oriented thinker with a strong customer orientation. You have proven excellent communication skills and have the capacity to learn technical content. You know to manage your time effectively and can adapt to changing priorities. You are a quick learner who is dedicated to improving.ResponsibilitiesServe as the A2LA contact for current accredited laboratories and laboratories seeking accreditation.Facilitate the accreditation process for various laboratories seeking and maintaining accreditation.Review and audit information submitted, including reports and corrective action, ultimately making a recommendation to accredit or not to accredit based on information collected.Become a subject matter expert for various standards, requirements, regulations, policies, and procedures.Maintain up to date data and information for accredited laboratories, those seeking accreditation, and stakeholders.Respond to inquiries via telephone and/or email.Participate in the Annual A2LA Technical Forum and Annual Meeting.Opportunities exist for travel to testing and/or calibration laboratories on the behalf of A2LA.This position does not include hands-on technical work.. Requirements: A2LA may provide exceptions to educational requirements for veterans who demonstrate the ability to perform the duties listed in this job posting.A successful candidate for these positions typically meets the following criteria:Bachelor's degree in a scientific field of study (Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Life Science, Biology, Chemistry, etc.) preferred. Other degrees may be considered.Excellent interpersonal and oral/written communication skills.Ability to work independently and remain self-motivated.Basic computer proficiency (Word, Excel, and Outlook).Knowledge of ISO/IEC 17025 and quality management systems (QMS) is preferred but not required.Laboratory experience preferred but not required.Bilingual in English/Spanish preferred but not required.Benefits and CompensationThe salary for this position is commensurate with experience. In addition, A2LA offers a robust 403(b) retirement plan and benefits package including medical, dental, HSA, FSA (medical and dependent), life insurance, short- and long-term disability, employee assistance program (EAP), AFLAC, tuition reimbursement and other pre-taxed benefits, paid-time off, 9 paid government holidays, 2 floating holidays, training and development, career advancement opportunities and much more!Working Environment & Physical RequirementsThe physical demands and work environment described here reflect those of a person, in this position, will typically encounter.Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to walk; sit for long hours, use fingers for typing; talk and hear. Project set-up in laboratory database and maintenance with focus on client contact information, analysis, turn-around-times and deliverables
Initiating field supply orders
Sample login review

Anticipates possible problems or inconsistencies with client or laboratory operations/processes and drives mid-course changes and corrections in order to avoid customer dissatisfaction.
Ensures the accuracy of project-specific requirements.

name: Warehouse Coordinator
description:
Overview:
About Central Coast Agriculture:
Headquartered north of Santa Barbara in the heart of the Santa Ynez Valley, CCA is a company focused on utilizing science and sustainability to grow quality, modern crops. Our unmatched commitment to innovating both organic farming and modern manufacturing means our customers have access to products that exceed expectations.

We breed, grow, and cultivate the highest quality cannabis so we can then process, manufacture, and package the highest quality single-source products on the market under our brand, Raw Garden.

We are a team of change makers, modern farmers, scientists, and business professionals focused on leading the charge for agricultural innovation.

We are on a mission to be the most trusted and loved brand in Cannabis.

Responsibilities:
About the Role:
As a Warehouse Coordinator, your primary responsibility is to ensure that all goods, including BOM and Cannabis materials are received, stored, tracked, and distributed appropriately. You will ensure that all materials moved through manufacturing are tracked in compliance with the law, in particular with California’s Department of Cannabis Control regulations. You will make certain that each step of the manufacturing process is kept up to date within CCA’s ERP system and other internal records. You will work closely with the manufacturing teams, including extraction, refinement, and distribution. A small team of technicians will be directed by you to support inventory, production, and ERP activities.

What You'll Do:
Maintain up to date inventory of all products within CCA’s ERP system, and work closely with the Track & Trace team to ensure alignment with METRC
Properly plan and ensure all departments have the right level of material inventory to meet weekly production goals
Work with Sales team to ensure proper flavor scheduling
Review all product being sent to the labs meets CCA lab testing standards
Ensure proper grading of crude extract to uphold CCA quality standards
Responsible for reviewing all compliance results to ensure all finished product is labeled compliantly and meet CCA quality standards
Responsible for ensuring the completion and accuracy of all data reporting done through CCA’s ERP system
Work closely with warehouse operations to maintain accurate inventory reporting and shipments of products to third-party distributors
Communicate with the distribution channel to ensure manifests and purchase orders are accurate before shipment
Manage both the distribution and manufacturing licenses within CCA”s ERP system
Work with the inventory lead and Track & Trace coordinator to complete regular in house audits of inventory to ensure accuracy of METRC and CCA’s ERP system
Maintain an open channel of communication with testing laboratory partners
Investigate, identify, and reconcile any inventory discrepancies with assistance from the inventory lead
You will make certain that inventory is consistently updated within CCA’s ERP system and reflects on-hand quantities
Ensure the seamless flow of materials through CCA’s ERP system for production
Audit processes and workflows for error and inconsistencies to increase the accuracy of inventories
Maintain compliance with federal, state, and local material handling, and shipping requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforce adherence to requirements; and advise leadership on needed actions
Review and make recommendations on operations procedures
Assist with the general upkeep of all materials related to the Track & Trace system
Keep up to date with professional and technical developments
Maintain professionalism and live CCA’s core values at all times
Perform all other duties as assigned or inherent to the position
Up to 10% of domestic travel expected
Maintain professionalism and live CCA’s core values at all times.
Perform all other duties as assigned or inherent to the position.

name: Kitchen Technician
description:
We are a new kind of cannabis company, aiming higher in everything we do. We grow and sell the highest-quality cannabis products available anywhere, inspiring wellness and wonder in our customers, wherever they are on their cannabis journey. We operate with a sense of responsibility to our customers and patients, building stronger and more socially responsible communities everywhere we go.

Ayr Wellness is an expanding vertically integrated, U.S. multi-state cannabis operator, focused on delivering the highest quality cannabis products and customer experience throughout its footprint. Based on the belief that everything starts with the quality of the plant, the Company is focused on superior cultivation to grow superior branded cannabis products. Ayr strives to enrich consumers’ experience higher every day through the wellness and wonder of cannabis.

Oasis Cannabis is a subsidiary of Ayr Wellness, operating three dispensaries in Arizona and multiple cultivation sites. If you are looking to join an exciting company that is growing rapidly in the Arizona cannabis industry, Oasis Cannabis is the place for you! Soon to be one of the largest cannabis producers in the state, we are looking for dedicated employees to join our team. This job is physically demanding, requiring frequent work from ladders and lifts. Professionalism, quality and teamwork are necessary for success in this position.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The Kitchen Technician is primarily responsible for the accurate creation, labeling, and packaging of all edibles.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Tech I

Adhere to SOP’s and Recipes to formulate edible cannabis products.Package, sticker, and count cannabis products/finished goodsConfirm batch and lot numbers on finished goods’ product labels are correctCoordinate third party Laboratory testing and transfersCoordinate and execute conversions and transfersCarefully manage inventory flow during busy order fulfillment periodsAbility to multi-task repeatedly with attention to detail and minimal errorsMaintain a clean and organized work environmentRead, understand, and follow all CCB regulations relating to inventory control and chain of custody
Other duties as assigned SKILLS/ABILITIES REQUIRED

Attention to detail with excellent record keeping abilityAbility to maintain a high level of cleanliness.Willingness to learn and improve each operationAbility to perform repetitive tasks for long periods of timeAbility to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-taskCommitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendanceAvailability to work occasional weekends and holidays
REQUIREMENTS/PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Ability to stand on feet or sit for extended periods of timeAbility to use repetitive use of hands, wrists and forearmsNormal vision or corrected by use of glasses and/or contacts for normal reading and viewing abilities to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned, or to make general observations of facilities or structures.Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to meet job and operate equipment requirementsRequires normal range of hearing with the ability to perceive the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication and making fine discriminations in sound.Ability to twist, turn, bend, stand and walk as required to perform the duties associated with functioning as a dispensary manager.Pushing/pulling/carrying, with the ability to lift up to 50 pounds occasionallyRegular and on-time attendance (Hours may exceed 40 hours per week)

name: Sales Executive
description:
Job Summary

The Sales Executive is responsible for generating new business, as well as maintaining and deepening our existing customer relationships. This includes sourcing, coordinating with, and meeting potential customers in the industry that have cannabis testing needs. Primary areas of focus are identifying new customers, promoting existing customer retention, and successfully onboarding new accounts. This role is an outside sales position.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Provide the highest level of customer service at all times. This is a relationship business.
Partner with cannabis professionals to educate them regarding testing requirements and benefits that CannaSafe delivers (our value proposition).
Deliver market research to industry professionals.
Implement industry knowledge to strengthen our existing customer relationships and broaden our lead pipeline.
Serve as a subject matter expert in our offerings, including, but not limited to, pricing, differentiation, and what we provide that our competitors do not.
Take sales orders and submit for processing per our internal SOP.
Educate customers on our process and ensure appropriate expectations are established and maintained regarding order timing and outcomes.
Deliver sales presentations to customers and for internal training purposes.
Network at industry events to gain key updates. Inform the team accordingly.
Perform heavy cold calling to schedule in person appointments. This may require creative sourcing methods, such as leveraging social media.
Meet our minimum number of in person and telephonic customer check-in meetings each week. These are focused on growing existing relationships and expanding services.
Hit and surpass other quotas as defined by the TBD Sales Leader.
Regularly maintain accurate, detailed, and current notes in HubSpot. This includes notes for existing and potential contacts.
Partner will all levels of employees to ensure communication is seamless at all times regarding updates to customer orders.
Generate and regularly deliver a variety of reports to the Leadership team.
Foster a success-oriented, accountable, and ethical environment.
Build strong internal, external, and cross-functional relationships.
Other duties and special projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

High degrees of self-motivation, initiative, sales acumen, analytical/technical ability, and decisive judgement.
Ability to build positive relationships and nurture them as needed in a sales environment.
Ability to maintain an incredibly high degree of attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to maintain confidence, confidentially, and composure during difficult and/or complex situations.
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced deadline environment while successfully managing multiple tasks.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively work, influence, problem solve, and communicate with all levels of the organization.
Proven work experience as sales representative in Cannabis Sales/lab Services
Travel up to 50%, including overnight travel.

Education and Experience
Required: A high school diploma (or GED) and at least three (3) years of related sales experience.
Required: A valid driver’s license and clean driving record.
Knowledge of chemistry and analytical laboratory principles, terminology, practices, techniques, and instrumentation.
Exposure to the cannabis industry.

Essential Functions

The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job the employee is frequently required to stand, handle or feel, to speak, and to hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required for this job include close (proximity) vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment described here is representative of that which an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The standard analytical laboratory environment is one in which potential health hazards do exist. Administrative, operations, technical, and professional staff are expected to safely operate in accordance with applicable and appropriate health and safety policies and procedures, as prescribed by the applicable CannaSafe manuals and policies and/or federal, state, or local standards.

Laboratory staff can be expected to work in areas where hazards associated are with, but not limited to, airborne pathogens. Biological materials, hazardous substances, and radioactive material exist and are handled. Appropriate training is provided regarding these hazards and staff are expected to adhere to all health and safety policies at all times, whether they are in writing or verbalized by a supervisor.

name: Laboratory Scientist 3 - BPH - Kanawha Co.
description:
Nature of Work

Department of Health and Human Resources (DHHR)/ Bureau for Public Health (BPH)/ Office of Laboratory Services, Kanawha County - Under limited supervision, this position will perform advanced level analytical, diagnostic, environmental and epidemiological laboratory testing. Performs a variety of laboratory tests, assays, analytical procedure validations and quality assurance and control studies in such fields as analytical and environmental chemistry, diagnostic and environmental microbiology and immunology, biochemistry, molecular biology, and virology. This position works independently with limited supervision, work is characterized by the degree of difficulty required. Perform tests that require specialized knowledge, training, and judgment; adapts or develops standard procedures to the extent permitted by laboratory policies. May be subject to being on-call during non-business hours and must be available to respond when needed. May be exposed to chemical and biological hazards. This position broadly applies principles, and theories to job assignments and performs related work as required. Specific duties include performing quality control on media, reagents, and equipment used in testing research and develop microbiological methods for testing of medical cannabis and medical cannabis containing products, perform validation or verification of developed methods undergo contaminant identification testing on medical cannabis and medical cannabis containing products using traditional bacteriological techniques such as gram stain, culture and total aerobic bacteria and yeast mold counts, perform contaminant characteristic identification of cannabis including odor, appearance, fineess, and moisture content using appropriate methods, and contaminant confirmatory testing on medical cannabis and medical cannabis containing products for mycotoxins using molecular techniques such as polymerase chain reaction. Other duties as assigned.

IMPORTANT: Your eligible score will be based on information provided in your application; therefore, make sure your application is detailed and complete. You may attach a resume and other documents; however, you should NEVER enter "See Resume" on the application. You MUST complete ALL parts of the application, including the Work Experience section.

ATTENTION: Applicant MUST VERIFY POST-HIGH SCHOOL EDUCATION (DIPLOMAS, DEGREES, etc.), TRAINING, or LICENSURE EARNED pertaining to this position BY THE CLOSING DATE OF THE POSTING, if not previously verified. It may ONLY be in the form of a copy of an OFFICIAL transcript or diploma. If you are claiming Veteran's preference, please submit "MEMBER 4" form and/or your VA Letter. DOCUMENTATION WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED AFTER THE CLOSING DATE and you will not be considered for this vacancy. Please attach documents to the online application before submitting it. Or, you may email it to: applicantservices@wv.gov or by FAX to 304-957-0396, or by mail to: WV Division of Personnel, 1900 Kanawha Blvd. E., Building 3, Suite 500, Charleston, WV 25305.

This announcement is for one or more specific vacancies and only applies to the location(s) indicated. Your application will remain active for this job for 180 days or until the job is filled. Application for this job does not automatically qualify you for other positions. Be sure to submit your application for each position of interest. To receive an email notice anytime jobs in this or other categories are posted, you may choose to complete a Job Interest Card from the slide-out menu located at the top left of our Job Opportunities page.

As a condition of employment, an inquiry into job-related information will be completed which may include, but not limited to, criminal records, abuse registry records, driving records, employment history, and education and training. Failing to cooperate with this process, providing false or incomplete information, and/or discovery of disqualifying information may result in denial of or dismissal from employment or denial of transfer irrespective of when discovered.

Minimum Qualifications

Training: Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university in a biological, microbiological, chemical or environmental science, medical technology, molecular biology, forensic sciences or related field.
AND
Experience: Three (3) years of full-time or equivalent part-time paid laboratory experience that is clinical or environmental in nature that produces a test result.
OR
Substitution: Graduate course work in one of the areas as described above from a regionally accredited college or university may substitute at the rate of one (1) year experience for fifteen (15) semester hours of education.

Special Requirement: For positions which involve processing and analysis of human specimens and/or the generation or interpretation of laboratory results that may be used in the diagnosis or treatment of a disease or condition in humans, the incumbent must have or be eligible for licensure as a WV Clinical Laboratory Practitioner as required by 64C.S.R.§57.

***DETAILS OF RELATED EXPERIENCE MUST BE SHOWN IN THE WORK EXPERIENCE SECTION OF YOUR ONLINE APPLICATION***

name: Accreditation Officer (Electrical, ISO, Quality)
description: Description: A2LA is a non-profit, public service membership organization offering compliance and accreditation services to organizations all over the world. A2LA is dedicated to formally recognizing testing, calibration and other laboratories and related organizations for their quality and technical competency with a variety of international standards (ISO/IEC 17025, ISO 15189, etc.), federal requirements (FDA, GLP, FCC, etc.), state (cannabis, etc.), and local requirements (water testing, etc.).Whether it is the clean air that you breathe, the water you drink, or the vehicle you drive, A2LA helps make the world a better, safer place by working to ensure that organizations are releasing products and services that are meeting testing and quality standards. Detailed information about our services can be found on our website at www.a2la.org/about.The RoleA2LA is seeking a motivated professional to oversee the day-to-day accreditation operation and ensure the quality of laboratories by monitoring the processes, procedures, and applicable standards. This is an exceptional opportunity to grow within a global non-profit organization as an Accreditation Officer.A2LA provides extensive onsite training to ensure a candidate's success within our organization and in this position. This includes a detailed six-month mentoring program.About YouYou are a detail-oriented thinker with a strong customer orientation. You have proven excellent communication skills and have the capacity to learn technical content. You know to manage your time effectively and can adapt to changing priorities. You are a quick learner who is dedicated to improving.ResponsibilitiesServe as the A2LA contact for current accredited laboratories and laboratories seeking accreditation.Facilitate the accreditation process for various laboratories seeking and maintaining accreditation.Review and audit information submitted, including reports and corrective action, ultimately making a recommendation to accredit or not to accredit based on information collected.Become a subject matter expert for various standards, requirements, regulations, policies, and procedures.Maintain up to date data and information for accredited laboratories, those seeking accreditation, and stakeholders.Respond to inquiries via telephone and/or email.Participate in the Annual A2LA Technical Forum and Annual Meeting.Opportunities exist for travel to testing and/or calibration laboratories on the behalf of A2LA.This position does not include hands-on technical work.. Requirements: A2LA may provide exceptions to educational requirements for veterans who demonstrate the ability to perform the duties listed in this job posting.A successful candidate for these positions typically meets the following criteria:Bachelor's degree in a scientific field of study (Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Life Science, Biology, Chemistry, etc.) preferred. Other degrees may be considered.Excellent interpersonal and oral/written communication skills.Ability to work independently and remain self-motivated.Basic computer proficiency (Word, Excel, and Outlook).Knowledge of ISO/IEC 17025 and quality management systems (QMS) is preferred but not required.Laboratory experience preferred but not required.Bilingual in English/Spanish preferred but not required.Benefits and CompensationThe salary for this position is commensurate with experience. In addition, A2LA offers a robust 403(b) retirement plan and benefits package including medical, dental, HSA, FSA (medical and dependent), life insurance, short- and long-term disability, employee assistance program (EAP), AFLAC, tuition reimbursement and other pre-taxed benefits, paid-time off, 9 paid government holidays, 2 floating holidays, training and development, career advancement opportunities and much more!Working Environment & Physical RequirementsThe physical demands and work environment described here reflect those of a person, in this position, will typically encounter.Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to walk; sit for long hours, use fingers for typing; talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision for reviewing documents on the computer or in hard copy state.Work Environment:  Work is typically performed in an office setting. Hours are flexible, but they should normally encompass at least the core hours of 9:00AM to 3:00PM, total at least forty (40) hours for each work week, and suit the needs of various training clients, where appropriate.To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.A2LA is an equal opportunity employer. A2LA does not discriminate in employment based upon race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, age, sex (including sexual harassment), sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, military status or unfavorable discharge from military service, or any other federally protected classification.Military/Military Spouse Personnel are encouraged to apply.Job Type: Full-timeWork Location:One locationWork Remotely:No

name: Warehouse Coordinator
description:
Overview:
About Central Coast Agriculture:
Headquartered north of Santa Barbara in the heart of the Santa Ynez Valley, CCA is a company focused on utilizing science and sustainability to grow quality, modern crops. Our unmatched commitment to innovating both organic farming and modern manufacturing means our customers have access to products that exceed expectations.

We breed, grow, and cultivate the highest quality cannabis so we can then process, manufacture, and package the highest quality single-source products on the market under our brand, Raw Garden.

We are a team of change makers, modern farmers, scientists, and business professionals focused on leading the charge for agricultural innovation.

We are on a mission to be the most trusted and loved brand in Cannabis.

Responsibilities:
About the Role:
As a Warehouse Coordinator, your primary responsibility is to ensure that all goods, including BOM and Cannabis materials are received, stored, tracked, and distributed appropriately. You will ensure that all materials moved through manufacturing are tracked in compliance with the law, in particular with California’s Department of Cannabis Control regulations. You will make certain that each step of the manufacturing process is kept up to date within CCA’s ERP system and other internal records. You will work closely with the manufacturing teams, including extraction, refinement, and distribution. A small team of technicians will be directed by you to support inventory, production, and ERP activities.

What You'll Do:
Maintain up to date inventory of all products within CCA’s ERP system, and work closely with the Track & Trace team to ensure alignment with METRC
Properly plan and ensure all departments have the right level of material inventory to meet weekly production goals
Work with Sales team to ensure proper flavor scheduling
Review all product being sent to the labs meets CCA lab testing standards
Ensure proper grading of crude extract to uphold CCA quality standards
Responsible for reviewing all compliance results to ensure all finished product is labeled compliantly and meet CCA quality standards
Responsible for ensuring the completion and accuracy of all data reporting done through CCA’s ERP system
Work closely with warehouse operations to maintain accurate inventory reporting and shipments of products to third-party distributors
Communicate with the distribution channel to ensure manifests and purchase orders are accurate before shipment
Manage both the distribution and manufacturing licenses within CCA”s ERP system
Work with the inventory lead and Track & Trace coordinator to complete regular in house audits of inventory to ensure accuracy of METRC and CCA’s ERP system
Maintain an open channel of communication with testing laboratory partners
Investigate, identify, and reconcile any inventory discrepancies with assistance from the inventory lead
You will make certain that inventory is consistently updated within CCA’s ERP system and reflects on-hand quantities
Ensure the seamless flow of materials through CCA’s ERP system for production
Audit processes and workflows for error and inconsistencies to increase the accuracy of inventories
Maintain compliance with federal, state, and local material handling, and shipping requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforce adherence to requirements; and advise leadership on needed actions
Review and make recommendations on operations procedures
Assist with the general upkeep of all materials related to the Track & Trace system
Keep up to date with professional and technical developments
Maintain professionalism and live CCA’s core values at all times
Perform all other duties as assigned or inherent to the position
Up to 10% of domestic travel expected
Maintain professionalism and live CCA’s core values at all times.
Perform all other duties as assigned or inherent to the position.

Qualifications:
Basic Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent certification. Bachelor’s degree in management, finance, or related field a plus
Demonstrated 3+ years of relevant experience, preferably within the cannabis industry
Able to lift to 50 pounds
Hands-on experience of Microsoft Office and/or Google’s G Suite, particularly Excel/Sheets
Functional knowledge of California cannabis regulations, specifically as it pertains to distribution and manufacturing
Must be 21 years of age (or older) at the time of hire
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Flexible work schedule as needed
Excellent time management and organizational skills in a fast-paced environment
Excellent interpersonal skills
Strong organizational and follow-up skills
Beginner/Intermediate/Expert user of Microsoft Office and/or Google’s G suite.
Must be 21 years of age (or older) at the time of hire.
Proficiency of the English language, verbal and written format.
Functional knowledge of California cannabis regulations.

What You'll Receive:
Competitive base salary and performance-based incentive plan.
Company Sponsored Activities
Health Coverages - CCA contributes to employee & dependent premiums!
Medical PPO & Rx Coverage
Dental PPO & HMO
Vision PPO
Other CCA Paid Benefits
Employee Assistance Programs w/Mental Health Support
Life & AD&D
Disability
Paid Time Off: vacation, sick, holiday, & bereavement

name: Kitchen Technician
description:
We are a new kind of cannabis company, aiming higher in everything we do. We grow and sell the highest-quality cannabis products available anywhere, inspiring wellness and wonder in our customers, wherever they are on their cannabis journey. We operate with a sense of responsibility to our customers and patients, building stronger and more socially responsible communities everywhere we go.

Ayr Wellness is an expanding vertically integrated, U.S. multi-state cannabis operator, focused on delivering the highest quality cannabis products and customer experience throughout its footprint. Based on the belief that everything starts with the quality of the plant, the Company is focused on superior cultivation to grow superior branded cannabis products. Ayr strives to enrich consumers’ experience higher every day through the wellness and wonder of cannabis.

Oasis Cannabis is a subsidiary of Ayr Wellness, operating three dispensaries in Arizona and multiple cultivation sites. If you are looking to join an exciting company that is growing rapidly in the Arizona cannabis industry, Oasis Cannabis is the place for you! Soon to be one of the largest cannabis producers in the state, we are looking for dedicated employees to join our team. This job is physically demanding, requiring frequent work from ladders and lifts. Professionalism, quality and teamwork are necessary for success in this position.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The Kitchen Technician is primarily responsible for the accurate creation, labeling, and packaging of all edibles.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Tech I

Adhere to SOP’s and Recipes to formulate edible cannabis products.Package, sticker, and count cannabis products/finished goodsConfirm batch and lot numbers on finished goods’ product labels are correctCoordinate third party Laboratory testing and transfersCoordinate and execute conversions and transfersCarefully manage inventory flow during busy order fulfillment periodsAbility to multi-task repeatedly with attention to detail and minimal errorsMaintain a clean and organized work environmentRead, understand, and follow all CCB regulations relating to inventory control and chain of custody
Other duties as assigned SKILLS/ABILITIES REQUIRED

Attention to detail with excellent record keeping abilityAbility to maintain a high level of cleanliness.Willingness to learn and improve each operationAbility to perform repetitive tasks for long periods of timeAbility to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-taskCommitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendanceAvailability to work occasional weekends and holidays
REQUIREMENTS/PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)Must have a clear understanding of weights and measures and ability to operate a scaleAbility to work within a team and on an individual basisFamiliarity with kitchen procedures and cleanliness standards.Ability to work in a timely manner and drive to increase productivityExperience and knowledge and familiarity with CannabisProficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook)Must be 21 years of age or older, and be able to pass an extensive background checkMust be authorized to work in the United States
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Ability to stand on feet or sit for extended periods of timeAbility to use repetitive use of hands, wrists and forearmsNormal vision or corrected by use of glasses and/or contacts for normal reading and viewing abilities to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned, or to make general observations of facilities or structures.Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to meet job and operate equipment requirementsRequires normal range of hearing with the ability to perceive the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication and making fine discriminations in sound.Ability to twist, turn, bend, stand and walk as required to perform the duties associated with functioning as a dispensary manager.Pushing/pulling/carrying, with the ability to lift up to 50 pounds occasionallyRegular and on-time attendance (Hours may exceed 40 hours per week)
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Work is performed in several locations that include a cannabis kitchen and production facility. The working area may be odorous at times and loud due to fans and filtration systems, fluctuating between cold and warm temperatures. Involves frequent contact with staff. Work may include dealing with law enforcement and occasional State inspectors.

name: Sales Executive
description:
Job Summary

The Sales Executive is responsible for generating new business, as well as maintaining and deepening our existing customer relationships. This includes sourcing, coordinating with, and meeting potential customers in the industry that have cannabis testing needs. Primary areas of focus are identifying new customers, promoting existing customer retention, and successfully onboarding new accounts. This role is an outside sales position.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Provide the highest level of customer service at all times. This is a relationship business.
Partner with cannabis professionals to educate them regarding testing requirements and benefits that CannaSafe delivers (our value proposition).
Deliver market research to industry professionals.
Implement industry knowledge to strengthen our existing customer relationships and broaden our lead pipeline.
Serve as a subject matter expert in our offerings, including, but not limited to, pricing, differentiation, and what we provide that our competitors do not.
Take sales orders and submit for processing per our internal SOP.
Educate customers on our process and ensure appropriate expectations are established and maintained regarding order timing and outcomes.
Deliver sales presentations to customers and for internal training purposes.
Network at industry events to gain key updates. Inform the team accordingly.
Perform heavy cold calling to schedule in person appointments. This may require creative sourcing methods, such as leveraging social media.
Meet our minimum number of in person and telephonic customer check-in meetings each week. These are focused on growing existing relationships and expanding services.
Hit and surpass other quotas as defined by the TBD Sales Leader.
Regularly maintain accurate, detailed, and current notes in HubSpot. This includes notes for existing and potential contacts.
Partner will all levels of employees to ensure communication is seamless at all times regarding updates to customer orders.
Generate and regularly deliver a variety of reports to the Leadership team.
Foster a success-oriented, accountable, and ethical environment.
Build strong internal, external, and cross-functional relationships.
Other duties and special projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

High degrees of self-motivation, initiative, sales acumen, analytical/technical ability, and decisive judgement.
Ability to build positive relationships and nurture them as needed in a sales environment.
Ability to maintain an incredibly high degree of attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to maintain confidence, confidentially, and composure during difficult and/or complex situations.
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced deadline environment while successfully managing multiple tasks.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively work, influence, problem solve, and communicate with all levels of the organization.
Proven work experience as sales representative in Cannabis Sales/lab Services
Travel up to 50%, including overnight travel.

Education and Experience
Required: A high school diploma (or GED) and at least three (3) years of related sales experience.
Required: A valid driver’s license and clean driving record.
Knowledge of chemistry and analytical laboratory principles, terminology, practices, techniques, and instrumentation.
Exposure to the cannabis industry.

Essential Functions

The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job the employee is frequently required to stand, handle or feel, to speak, and to hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required for this job include close (proximity) vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment described here is representative of that which an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The standard analytical laboratory environment is one in which potential health hazards do exist. Administrative, operations, technical, and professional staff are expected to safely operate in accordance with applicable and appropriate health and safety policies and procedures, as prescribed by the applicable CannaSafe manuals and policies and/or federal, state, or local standards.

Laboratory staff can be expected to work in areas where hazards associated are with, but not limited to, airborne pathogens. Biological materials, hazardous substances, and radioactive material exist and are handled. Appropriate training is provided regarding these hazards and staff are expected to adhere to all health and safety policies at all times, whether they are in writing or verbalized by a supervisor.
